item.title: EXCLUSIVE | 'Workload management is bull****, created by Australians': Ex-India pacer on Jasprit Bumrah b - The Times of India
item.description:
EXCLUSIVE | 'Workload management is bull****, created by Australians': Ex-India pacer on Jasprit Bumrah bowling 150-plus overs in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Published on: [Insert Date] | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah's heavy bowling load during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he bowled over 150 overs. Former Indian pacer Balwinder Sandhu critiques the concept of workload management in cricket.

  • Bumrah bowled 151.2 overs and took 32 wickets during the series.
  • Concerns were raised about his physical limits due to the workload.
  • Sandhu argues that workload management is a concept created by Australians and insists that bowlers should listen to their bodies.
  • He emphasizes that bowlers are capable of managing such workloads with proper conditioning.
"Workload management is bull****. These are Australian terms, created by Australians. I don’t agree with this at all," said Balwinder Sandhu.

The article highlights an ongoing debate in cricket regarding player workload and the expectations placed on bowlers in Test matches.

item.title: First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Pakistan fought valiantly but ultimately lost to South Africa in the second Test at Cape Town, despite a remarkable 478 runs in the second innings while following on, led by captain Shan Masood's 145.

  • Pakistan set a record total of 478 while following on, the highest by a visiting team in South Africa in 136 years.
  • The previous record for the highest follow-on total was 372/7 by Australia in 1902.
  • Shan Masood's innings of 145 was pivotal along with significant contributions from Babar Azam (81) and other batsmen.
  • Despite the impressive total, South Africa chased down a target of 58 runs comfortably.
  • The win secured South Africa's top position in the World Test Championship table.
“It surpasses the previous best follow-on total of 372/7 set by Australia in Johannesburg in 1902.”

In conclusion, while Pakistan put up a historic performance, South Africa confirmed their dominance by clinching the series 2-0 and setting their sights on the upcoming World Test Championship final.

item.title: India's Squad For Champions Trophy: Not Hardik Pandya Or Shubman Gill, This Star To Be Vice-Captain,.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Champions Trophy Squad: Not Hardik Or Gill, This Star To Be Vice-Captain, Says Report

Date: 13 June 2024 | Source: NDTV

The announcement of India's squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 is upcoming, with reports suggesting Rohit Sharma will captain and Jasprit Bumrah is expected to be vice-captain, pending recovery from injury.

  • Rohit Sharma is confirmed to lead India in the Champions Trophy.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is likely to be named vice-captain, replacing Hardik Pandya and Shubman Gill.
  • Bumrah's fitness is uncertain after an injury in the final Test against Australia.
  • The vice-captaincy role has seen significant changes in recent years.
“The vice-captaincy in limited-overs cricket has switched hands considerably.”

Should Bumrah be unable to play, it could lead to further debates on the vice-captaincy choice, leaving India with no clear frontrunner.

item.title: "Shubman Gill is a highly overrated cricketer": Srikkanth attacks young player, names three new batters for selection - Crictoday
item.description:
“Shubman Gill is a highly overrated cricketer”: Srikkanth attacks young player, names three new batters for selection

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Shubman Gill faced criticism after a disappointing showing in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, underperforming compared to expectations set by a strong previous series.

  • Gill scored 13, 20, 1, 28, and 31 in the series, contributing to India's 1-3 loss.
  • Kris Srikkanth labeled Gill as overrated, questioning his continued selection over players like Suryakumar Yadav.
  • Srikkanth suggested that domestic performers Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sai Sudharsan should be considered over Gill.
  • Gill managed to survive selection due to rare performances, but Srikkanth emphasized the need for consistency in challenging conditions.
Kris Srikkanth: “Gill has managed to survive because he scores in one out of ten chances.”

The conversation around Gill's selection reflects broader discussions about player performance and meritocracy in the Indian cricket team.

item.title: Manu Bhaker's net worth was Rs 60 lakh before Paris Olympic, now her net worth has jumped to Rs.... - India.com
item.description:
Manu Bhaker's Net Worth Surge After Paris Olympics

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India.com

New Delhi: Ace shooter Manu Bhaker made history at the 2024 Paris Olympics, winning two bronze medals and becoming the first Indian woman to achieve such a milestone in shooting. Her financial journey has also seen substantial growth.

Key Points:

  • As of 2024, Manu Bhaker’s net worth is estimated at Rs 12 crore, up from Rs 60 lakh before the Olympics.
  • Her earnings are largely derived from her shooting career and endorsements with brands like Nothing India and Performax.
  • Female athletes in India typically earn between Rs 8 lakh to Rs 30 lakh per endorsement.
  • Reports indicate her brand value to be around Rs 1.5 crore.

Early Investments:

  • Bhaker started her journey with an initial investment of Rs 1.5 lakh from her father.
  • Organizations like Olympic Gold Quest (OGQ) have supported her financially.
  • She received Rs 12,16,257 from the Sports Authority of India (SAI) under the Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS).
  • Financial support from the Annual Calendar for Training and Competition (ACTC) amounted to Rs 1,50,67,390.

This financial backing has greatly aided her training and competitive endeavors.

Conclusion:

Manu Bhaker's rise in net worth reflects not only her success as an athlete but also the growing recognition and support for female sports in India.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma's hunger should show in his actions' - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's hunger should show in his actions

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Rohit Sharma is reminded to demonstrate his hunger for success through his performances on the field, emphasizing the need for players to convert talent into results.

  • Emphasis on Rohit Sharma's need to show his determination through actions.
  • Calls for players to translate their skills into on-field achievements.
  • Focus on the importance of motivation in sports performance.
“It's not enough to have talent; you must have the will to succeed.”

This article serves as a motivational reminder for athletes to back up their abilities with consistent performance.

item.title: Cricket Australia Reacts After Sunil Gavaskar's Complaint Over Border-Gavaskar Trophy Presentation Snub: 'I - News18
item.description:
Cricket Australia Reacts After Sunil Gavaskar's Complaint Over Border-Gavaskar Trophy Presentation Snub

Date: January 06, 2025

Source: News18

After Sunil Gavaskar expressed his disappointment at not being invited to join Allan Border in handing over the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Cricket Australia acknowledged the oversight.

  • Sunil Gavaskar was not invited to the trophy presentation for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Australia won the series against India 3-1, reclaiming the trophy.
  • Gavaskar expressed his desire to participate in the ceremony, stating that it is a representation of both nations.
  • A CA spokesperson acknowledged that both Gavaskar and Border should have been invited to the stage.
“It should not matter that Australia won when it comes to the presentation... Just because I am an Indian, I did not present the trophy.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The incident highlights the importance of inclusivity in sports recognition and events.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 18:17 IST

Jasprit Bumrah has sustained back spasms during the fifth Test between India and Australia, leading to concerns about his participation in the upcoming series against England.

  • Bumrah is expected to miss the majority of the white-ball series against England.
  • The extent of his injury is currently unknown, and a decision will be made based on that.
  • If it's a Grade 1 injury, recovery may take two to three weeks; a Grade 2 injury could require up to six weeks; a Grade 3 injury might lead to a three-month absence.
  • India will host England for five T20Is starting January 22, followed by three ODIs.
"The fresh blow has renewed focus on Bumrah’s workload and the Indian team’s overdependence on him."

The severity of Bumrah's injury will determine if he misses the entire ODI series or can participate in at least one match before the Champions Trophy in February.

item.title: Christian comes out of retirement to help injury-hit Thunder - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Dan Christian Returns from Retirement to Aid Sydney Thunder

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australian T20 legend Dan Christian comes out of retirement to help the injury-affected Sydney Thunder in the Big Bash League (BBL).

Christian, 41, last played for the Sydney Sixers and has served as an assistant coach at Thunder. He has been active in local cricket to maintain his fitness.

  • Christian is joining players in their 40s who compete in the BBL.
  • Thunder faces a mounting injury toll including Bancroft and Sams.
  • He aims to make an impactful return amidst the team's challenging season.
“I made the decision during the off season that a return to the BBL or any other T20 leagues was never entirely off the table for me.” - Dan Christian

Trent Copeland, Thunder's general manager, expressed excitement about Christian's return, emphasizing his capability and experience.

item.title: Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria - Chess.com
item.description:
Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Chess.com

The reign of GM Magnus Carlsen as the king of chess now includes a queen.

  • Magnus Carlsen married Ella Victoria Malone in Oslo.
  • The ceremony took place at Holmenkollen Chapel with close family and friends.
  • The reception was held at Oslo's 5-star Grand Hotel.
  • Guests included sports figures, commentators, and Carlsen's long-time coach.
  • A Netflix film crew was present for a chess-related show.
  • Ella Victoria, now Carlsen, holds a multifaceted background having lived in Norway, the USA, and Singapore.

Sometimes it's difficult to come with him to these tournaments, but I do it anyway because I want to be a good girlfriend and support him, and it's something I'm getting used to.

—Ella Victoria Malone on her now husband Magnus Carlsen

Ella is expected to play a larger role in Carlsen's career, including securing sponsorship deals. Magnus continues to be active in competitive chess.

item.title: Virat-Anushka to Yuzi-Dhanashree, cricketers who married Bollywood actors - India TV News
item.description:
Virat Kohli-Anushka Sharma to Yuzi Chahal-Dhanashree Verma, Cricketers Who Married Bollywood Actors

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: India TV News

This article explores the marriages of prominent Indian cricketers with Bollywood actresses, shedding light on both joyous unions and their occasional controversies.

  • Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have been together since 2017 and are now parents.
  • Yuzi Chahal and Dhanashree Verma are reportedly facing divorce rumors after unfollowing each other on Instagram.
  • Hardik Pandya and Natasa Stankovic married in 2020 but have since separated while co-parenting.
  • Yuvraj Singh and Hazel Keech married in 2016 and have two children.
  • Harbhajan Singh tied the knot with actress Geeta Basra after five years of dating.
  • Mohammad Azharuddin's marriage to actress Sangeeta Bijlani was a major talking point in the 90s due to their eventual divorce.
  • Sharmila Tagore married cricket legend Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi in 1968 and has three children.
“Marriages between cricketers and Bollywood stars have always intrigued fans, with each pairing making headlines for various reasons.”

This article not only highlights these marriages but also reflects on the impact of celebrity relationships in both the cricket and film industries.

item.title: Shan Masood 'baffled' by Hawkeye trajectory following lbw dismissal - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Shan Masood Questions Hawkeye Decision After LBW Dismissal

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Pakistan captain Shan Masood expressed confusion over a Hawkeye review that led to his lbw dismissal during the final day of the Cape Town Test against South Africa. Masood was struck on the pads by a delivery that he believed was an outswinger, yet Hawkeye indicated it had struck off-stump on the review.

Despite a strong innings of 145, Masood was dissatisfied with the decision-making process and Hawkeye's accuracy, stating that the technology misrepresented the ball's trajectory.

  • Masood was initially ruled not out by umpire Nitin Menon.
  • The decision was reversed after a review which showed the ball hitting off-stump.
  • Masood claimed the Hawkeye visuals did not match the real-time event, asserting the delivery was an outswinger.
  • He displayed visible frustration post-dismissal, questioning the reliability of the technology used.
"I certainly felt that technology didn't show the trajectory of how that ball was." - Shan Masood

The incident sparked discussions about technology's role in cricket and its accuracy in reflecting on-field events.

item.title: Not Gill Or Pandya! 31-Year-Old Star Likely To Be India's Vice-Captain In Champions Trophy 2025 - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Likely to be Vice-Captain for India in Champions Trophy 2025

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: News18

With the conclusion of the Test series against Australia, India aims to shift focus to preparations for the ICC Champions Trophy, commencing on February 19, 2025, with Jasprit Bumrah expected to take on the role of vice-captain.

  • India's first match in the Champions Trophy will be against Bangladesh on February 20, followed by a highly anticipated match against Pakistan on February 23.
  • Bumrah has been a key player, having led in critical matches during the Test series against Australia.
  • The final squad for the Champions Trophy is expected to be announced by January 12.
  • Other regulars like Shreyas Iyer and Hardik Pandya are also likely to be included in the squad.
  • India is set to play three ODIs against England to gear up for the tournament.
"Bumrah, who led India in the first and fifth Tests, will serve as Rohit Sharma’s deputy if he is fit."

This upcoming Champions Trophy in Dubai will be crucial for India's white-ball cricket strategy and performance on the international stage.

item.description:
Where to Watch Real Madrid vs Deportiva Minera for Copa del Rey Clash

Real Madrid will begin their Copa del Rey journey with a trip to lower league side Deportiva Minera on Monday. The victory lifted Los Blancos into first place in the La Liga table with 43 points, two clear of Atlético Madrid.

  • Real Madrid remains undefeated in their last six games.
  • Deportivo Minera currently sits eighth in the Segunda Federacion - Group 4.

The victory lifted Los Blancos into first place in the La Liga table with 43 points, two clear of Atlético Madrid.

item.title: Record-breaking attendance in Border-Gavaskar Trophy leaves Ravi Shastri, Ricky Ponting in awe - The Times of India
item.description:
Record-breaking attendance in Border-Gavaskar Trophy leaves Ravi Shastri, Ricky Ponting in awe

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

This article discusses the remarkable record-breaking attendance at the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy series between India and Australia, with cricket legends Ravi Shastri and Ricky Ponting praising the turnout.

  • The series attracted 837,000 spectators across five matches.
  • Australia won the series 3-1, ending India's long-standing dominance.
  • Ravi Shastri highlighted a record attendance of 375,000 at the Melbourne Test.
  • Ponting discussed the implications of attendance numbers for the rivalry's significance.
“Right now, it's really hard to argue that this isn't the biggest rivalry in world cricket.” - Ricky Ponting

The record attendance signifies a growing interest in cricket, as emphasized by the comments from Shastri and Ponting regarding its increasing popularity and significance.

item.title: South Africa register emphatic 10-wicket win over Pakistan in 2nd Test, win series 2-0 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
South Africa Secures 10-Wicket Victory Over Pakistan in 2nd Test

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

South Africa achieved a comprehensive 10-wicket victory over Pakistan in the second Test, clinching the series 2-0 in Cape Town.

  • Pakistan, forced to follow-on, scored 478 all out after being 421 runs behind.
  • South Africa chased down a target of 58 runs with ease in just 7.1 overs.
  • David Bedingham remained not out on 44 from 30 balls.
  • Shan Masood led Pakistan's effort with 145 runs before being dismissed.
  • South Africa will face Australia in the Test championship final at Lord's in June.
“South Africa will go into the Test championship final against Australia at Lord's in June on the back of seven straight wins.”

This victory highlights South Africa's current dominance in Test cricket and their impressive form leading into the championship final.

item.title: Liverpool set dismal Premier League record which summed up performance against Man Utd - The Mirror
item.description:
Liverpool Set Disappointing Premier League Record Against Manchester United

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: The Mirror

Liverpool made history for an unwanted reason after drawing 2-2 with Manchester United, becoming the first team to register zero tackles in the first half of a Premier League game this season.

  • Liverpool dominated the 2024-25 league season but faced a setback against Manchester United.
  • Manchester United opened the scoring with a goal from Lisandro Martinez.
  • Liverpool equalized through Cody Gakpo and took the lead with a penalty by Mohamed Salah.
  • Amad Diallo scored a late equalizer for United.
  • Statistically, Liverpool ended the match with only two tackles won.
“It’s not so easy to take control if the other team plays every ball into your last line, then the ball is constantly in the air and there’s constantly duels.” - Arne Slot

The game reflected Liverpool's struggle against aggressive play from Manchester United, affecting their momentum in the title race.

item.title: Brain teaser: You'll be crowned the puzzle king, if you solve this perplexing riddle - Hindustan Times
item.description:
A viral brain teaser puzzled users with its cryptic clues and creative guesses about its unexpected answer.

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Brain teasers are captivating users on social media platforms like Instagram and X, with riddles that challenge our thinking and spark creativity. A recent riddle has taken the internet by storm.

  • The riddle states: "I have a head like a cat and feet like a cat, but I am not a cat. What am I?"
  • Users have provided various guesses, from tigers to abstract interpretations.
  • Another riddle from Twitter prompted discussions on logic and reasoning.
“Puzzles like these tap into our competitive spirit and curiosity, offering a shared moment of fun.”

Engaging with these challenges provides a break from daily routines and fosters a sense of community among participants.

item.title: "Don't Need Players Who...": Sunil Gavaskar's Stern 'Star Culture' Advice To BCCI - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Don't Need Players Who...: Sunil Gavaskar's Stern 'Star Culture' Advice To BCCI

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 Source: NDTV

Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar urged the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) to end the 'star culture' present in the Indian cricket team following the series loss against Australia. Gavaskar emphasized the need for total commitment from players to Indian cricket.

  • Gavaskar criticized the 'star culture' and called for players to be available for selection at all times.
  • He stated that total commitment to Indian cricket is non-negotiable.
  • Disappointment was expressed over India's failure to reach the World Test Championship final.
  • Gavaskar urged the BCCI to stop pampering players and prioritize the team's interests.
“The star culture has to end. Total commitment to Indian cricket is non-negotiable...”

India's next assignment is the white-ball series against England at home.

item.title: ‘Gill is overrated’: Srikkanth tears into India star in fiery message to Agarkar, suggests 3 players for selection - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Srikkanth Critiques Gill's Performance and Proposes Selection Changes

Date: Jan 06, 2025 09:58 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

Kris Srikkanth has voiced strong criticism of Shubman Gill, labeling him an overrated player and suggesting alternate selections for the Indian cricket team. His comments follow Gill's poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024, where India faced a 3-1 series loss to Australia.

  • Srikkanth called Gill an overrated cricketer during a YouTube segment.
  • He questioned Gill's continued selection on the national team.
  • Srikkanth proposed Suryakumar Yadav, Ruturaj Gaikwad, and Sai Sudharsan as more deserving players.
  • He criticized the trend of selecting players failing to perform consistently, citing Gill's poor scores in recent matches.
“I’ve always maintained that Shubman Gill is an overrated cricketer but nobody listened to me.” - Kris Srikkanth

Srikkanth's remarks come in the context of ongoing debates about team selections amidst fluctuating performances in international cricket.

item.title: ‘Gill is overrated’: Srikkanth tears India star to shreds in fiery message to Agarkar, suggests 3 players for selection - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Srikkanth Critiques Shubman Gill's Performance and Suggests Alternatives for Selection

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

India’s Shubman Gill faces criticism from cricket legend Kris Srikkanth, who discusses Gill's recent poor performances and suggests alternatives for team selection.

  • Srikkanth labels Gill as an “overrated cricketer”, citing his underwhelming performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024.
  • He questions the selectors’ choice to favor Gill over other deserving players like Suryakumar Yadav, Ruturaj Gaikwad, and Sai Sudharsan.
  • Gill's series scores were 13, 20, 1, 28, and 31, leading to his exclusion from the Test side.
  • Srikkanth emphasizes the importance of scoring in challenging conditions, particularly outside of India.
“I’ve always maintained that Shubman Gill is an overrated cricketer but nobody listened to me.” - Kris Srikkanth

Srikkanth’s remarks spark discussion on the efficiency and effectiveness of the current selection policy in Indian cricket.

item.title: "Everything was fine when Rahul Dravid was there": Harbhajan Singh suprised by Team India's downfall under Gautam Gambhir - Crictoday
item.description:
“Everything was fine when Rahul Dravid was there”: Harbhajan Singh suprised by Team India’s downfall under Gautam Gambhir

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh questioned the team’s decline following Rahul Dravid's tenure as head coach. India recently lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to Australia by a score of 1-3, marking a significant downturn since Dravid's departure.

  • India celebrated success under Dravid, winning the ICC T20 World Cup 2024.
  • Gautam Gambhir took over as head coach but has seen disappointing results since.
  • India lost their ODI series against Sri Lanka (0-2) and struggled in Test series against New Zealand (0-3).
  • Harbhajan Singh advocates for selecting players based on current form, criticizing reliance on past reputations.
  • Notable struggles from key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in recent series.
“In the past six months, we lost to Sri Lanka, New Zealand and Australia. Everything was fine till Rahul Dravid was our coach. We won the T20 World Cup and everything was looking good.”

The commentary from Harbhajan highlights the urgency for the selectors to move away from a “superstar culture” and focus on deserving players.
